comments.body: Not sure if it matters for `exitCode`, but the difference between `whenComplete` and `then` is that `whenComplete` will also trigger if there's an error.
Yeah. exitCode won't ever fail though, and whenComplete doesn't give me the value.

Who was meant to call this method with `flavor` parameter specified? None of the five call sites below specify that `flavor` option.
I'm curious because I normally use `android_debug_unopt`, rather than `android_debug`.

There was a call site passing 'debug', but I removed it. Should have maybe killed the parameter `flavor` too, but decided to keep it for potential future use. 

Is `android_debug_unopt` a good variant when you do performance measurements though?

> Is android_debug_unopt a good variant when you do performance measurements though?

As long as you consistently use that variant, I think it is good indicator of hot reload performance, yes. We also refer to that variant on flutter docs(https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md, for example).

This feels pretty fragile, does the Dart team know we depend on this specific line format?
Maybe worth adding a comment where they print this information to emphasize that Flutter depends on it?

We don't really depend on it so much as we'll just need to update the pattern when they change.

In reality, it's quite possible that there's people out there who do depend on it. Any time you change anything, you could break people.
